meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny! It's that time again where I get to dive into the world of Crisis Core: Final Fantasy VII Reunion. Now, I know what you're thinking - another remaster review? Yeah, but hear me out. This one's different. Like, really different.

As I jumped into Zack Fair's shoes once more, I couldn't help but think about all those other reviewers who've already gushed about this game. You know, the ones who gave it perfect scores and praised its visuals and combat mechanics? Yeah, they're not wrong. But let me tell you, I'm not just here to regurgitate the same old praises.

What sets Crisis Core apart is that it's more than just a remaster - it's an experience. It's like Square Enix took the original game from 2007 and said, "Hey, we can do better." And boy, did they ever. The graphics are stunning, the combat is tight, and Zack's story is still as captivating as ever.

Now, I know some of you might be thinking, "But what about the old timers? The ones who played the original on their PSP?" Well, let me tell you - this remaster is not just for them. It's for everyone. For those new to the series, it's a chance to experience Zack's adventures in all its glory. And for fans of Final Fantasy VII Remake, well... let's just say that this is the perfect opportunity to get your Crisis Core fix before the Rebirth game drops next year.

Of course, not every review is going to be sunshine and rainbows. I mean, even the lowly 40 out of 100 from Metro GameCentral has some truth to it. But hey, who doesn't love a good underdog story? Maybe that reviewer just wanted to ruffle some feathers. Or maybe they're just really harsh.

In any case, Crisis Core: Final Fantasy VII Reunion is a must-play for anyone looking to relive the magic of Zack's adventures or experience it for the first time. And hey, even if you're not a fan of JRPGs, it's still worth checking out - this game has something for everyone.

So, what are you waiting for? Go grab that controller and get ready to join Zack on his epic quest!
